DOCNAME: CASE OF RISTESKA v. "THE FORMER YUGOSLAV REPUBLIC OF MACEDONIA"
JUDGES: Karel Jungwiert;Mark Villiger;Mirjana Lazarova Trajkovska;Peer Lorenzen;Rait Maruste;Renate Jaeger;Zdravka Kalaydjieva
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE she complained to her employer about her treatment at work .
CARDINAL . On DATE the employer dismissed the applicant , considering her complaint as a request for resignation . The applicant 's objection remained undecided .
CARDINAL . On DATE she claimed before ORG ( “ the first - instance court ” ) annulment of the dismissal decision , her reinstatement and payment of unpaid salary .

CARDINAL . On DATE the court ordered expert examination of the applicant 's mental state of health on DATE , the date when she had submitted her complaints to the employer . The applicant was ordered to pay the expert fees within DATE . On DATE the first - instance court noted that the applicant had failed to pay the fees .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court ordered expert examination of the applicant 's mental health again . The applicant paid the expert fees on DATE . The expert opinion was submitted on DATE .
CARDINAL . During the trial proceedings , CARDINAL hearings were adjourned due to the incorrect delivery of court summons to the applicant and her lawyer .

CARDINAL . On DATE the first - instance court dismissed ( одбива ) the applicant 's claim as having been submitted out of the DATE statutory time - limit . On DATE ORG quashed this decision since the applicant 's claim should have been rejected ( отфрла ) instead .

CARDINAL . On DATE the first - instance court rejected the applicant 's claim as out of time . On DATE the applicant was exempted of court fees ( судска такса ) . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant 's appeal of DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant submitted to ORG an appeal on points of law ( ревизија ) arguing that the DATE time - limit had been of a non - binding ( инструктивен ) nature . In this connection , she referred to a decision of DATE in which ORG allegedly had given such reasoning .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant 's appeal stating that the statutory time - limit had been of a preclusive nature . This decision was served on the applicant on DATE .
